title: What is the general solution of the non-exact differential equation y dx = x (x^2 y -1) dy? - Quora

response.answer_text: The equation ydx = x(x^2y -1 ) can be rewritten as dx/dy = x^3 - x/y , or in the Bernoulli’s form dx/dy +x/y = x^3 . Take x = V(y)^(-1/2) and the equation becomes V’ - 2/y = -2 which is an ordinary and linear first order DE in normal form. The integrating factor is 1/y^2 and the solution is given by V = (y^2)[ Integral of ( -2dy/y^2 ) + C ] . Follows V = 2y + Cy^2 and the solution (2y + Cy^2)x^2 -1 =0 .
